body: @icewind1991 do you have an idea what the problem with oc_permissions could be?

hi, i'm tryng to update from 5.0.3 to 5.0.4 using firefox for window$ v 19.0.2. owcloud is installed in my qnap 412 fw 3.8.2 i'm trying to update it from the browser it shows a progress bar and : error: failed to create backup after that owncloud is still working.

no more errors showed.

same here.  went from 5.0.3 to 5.0.4 and now i'm stuck in maintenance mode.  woohoo!  rebooted, gave it some time but nothing has changed.  when maintenance started i received the following message:
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
updating owncloud to version 5.0.4, this may take a while.

turned on maintenance mode
failed to get existing database structure for updating (mdb2 error: unknown error, _doquery: [error message: could not execute statement] [last executed query: select sql from sqlite_master where type='table' and name='oc_bookmarks'] [native code: 5] [native message: database is locked] )

the update was unsuccessful. please report this issue to the owncloud community.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
i'm using sqlite.  my linux is crunchbang linux  2.6.32-5-amd64

visualjeff

what's up with font?  i come across as a jerk.

visualjeff

and as a guy who can't write.

visualjeff

i’m closing this issue because it has been inactive for a few months. this probably means that the issue is not reproducible or it has been fixed in a newer version.

please reopen if you still encounter this issue with the [latest stable version](http://owncloud.org/install/) (currently owncloud 5.0.9) and then please use the [issue template](https://raw.github.com/owncloud/core/master/issue_template.md). you an also contribute directly by providing a patch – see the [developer manual](http://doc.owncloud.org/server/5.0/developer_manual/). :)

thank you!
